metadata.Title: CVE-2023-43665 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Django 3.2 before 3.2.22, 4.1 before 4.1.12, and 4.2 before 4.2.6, the django.utils.text.Truncator chars() and words() methods (when used with html=True) are subject to a potential DoS (denial of service) attack via certain inputs with very long, potentially malformed HTML text. The chars() and words() methods are used to implement the truncatechars_html and truncatewords_html template filters, which are thus also vulnerable. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2019-14232.

criterions.comment: python-django: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
